hero.title:
Stuck in <0>HIPAA Compliance Hell</0>
During Cloud Migration?
hero.subtitle: I've successfully migrated <0>12 healthcare systems</0> to AWS without a single <1>HIPAA violation</1>, <2>data breach</2>, or <3>downtime incident</3>.

problems.title: Sound Familiar?
problems.subtitle: These are the top 3 challenges healthcare organizations face during cloud migration.

item1.title: We Keep Failing HIPAA Audits
item1.desc: Your on-premise system can't meet modern compliance requirements.
item1.impact: Every audit is a gamble that could cost you €50K+ in findings.

item2.title: Cloud Migration Seems Too Risky
item2.desc: You've tried twice. Both times stopped due to data breach concerns.
item2.impact: Your board won't approve another failed attempt.

item3.title: We're Running Out of Time
item3.desc: New HIPAA requirements in 6 months. Legacy vendor EOL in 12 months.
item3.impact: If you don't migrate soon, you'll face penalties AND downtime.

problems.solution: I've heard this 100 times. Here's how we solve it.

process.title: The Zero-Downtime, 100% Compliant Migration Process
process.subtitle: A proven 4-phase approach that's worked 12 times without a single incident

phase1.title: Compliance Audit
activities: Review all HIPAA/FHIR controls against current system
phase1.outcome: Clear roadmap with zero compliance risk

phase2.title: AWS Architecture Design
activities: Create rollback procedures for every step

phase3.title: Migration Execution
phase3.outcome: Zero downtime, all systems running on AWS

phase4.title: Optimization & Validation
activities: Train your team on AWS operations

roi.title: Calculate Your Potential Savings
roi.subtitle: See what you could save with a properly executed healthcare cloud migration

proof.title: Real Results from Real Projects
proof.subtitle: Don't just take my word for it—here's the proof

faq.title: Common Questions
faq.subtitle: Addressing your concerns about healthcare cloud migration

q1.q: What if we have a data breach during migration?
q1.a: Zero-downtime strategy means your production system never goes offline. Data is encrypted in transit (TLS 1.3) and at rest (AES-256). We migrate in phases with rollback procedures at every step. In 12 migrations, we've never had a breach. Every migration includes a comprehensive security audit before, during, and after.

q2.q: How long will we be down?
q2.a: Zero downtime. Migrations happen during off-hours with parallel systems running. Users never see disruption. We use blue-green deployment strategies and can roll back instantly if needed. Your team continues working normally throughout the entire process.

q3.q: What if HIPAA requirements change mid-migration?
q3.a: Architecture is designed for compliance flexibility. We monitor regulatory changes continuously and adapt the plan proactively. Your system will meet current AND future requirements. We include buffer time and contingency plans for regulatory updates.

q4.q: We don't have budget for this.
q4.a: Average ROI is 285% in year 1. Most clients save enough to pay for the project within 8 months through infrastructure optimization alone. Use the ROI calculator above to see YOUR potential savings. Many organizations find the migration pays for itself through avoided audit penalties and reduced operational costs.

q5.q: How do I know you won't leave us stranded?
q5.a: Every project includes 90 days post-migration support and complete documentation. I train your team to operate the new system independently. You get runbooks, architecture diagrams, and access to me for questions. Several clients from 3+ years ago still reach out occasionally—I'm always available.

seo.title: Free Architecture Guide | Prasad Tilloo
seo.description: 10 Architecture Decisions That Create Unnecessary Risk (and Cost). A vendor-neutral checklist for modernization decisions.

guide.title: Free guide
guide.headline: 10 Architecture Decisions That Create Unnecessary Risk (and Cost)
guide.subheadline: A vendor-neutral checklist for modernization decisions. Short, practical, and based on real enterprise patterns.

form.consentLabel: I agree to receive the guide by email.

success.trustNote: Direct response • No sales pitch • Vendor-neutral advice

content.title: Guide Preview
content.intro: Here's a preview of the 10 architecture decisions covered in the guide:
content.decision1.desc: Vendor reference architectures are starting points, not final solutions. They're optimized for the vendor's ecosystem, not your specific constraints, team capabilities, or business context.
content.decision2: "Start with Kubernetes" is often a maturity mismatch
content.decision2.desc: Kubernetes requires significant operational maturity. Many teams jump to Kubernetes before they have the skills, processes, or scale to justify it, creating unnecessary complexity.
content.decision3: Ignoring integration complexity early creates hidden delivery risk
content.decision3.desc: Integration patterns are often underestimated. Legacy systems, data formats, and API contracts create hidden complexity that can derail timelines if not addressed early.
content.decision4: Treating compliance as a constraint (not just documentation)
content.decision4.desc: Compliance requirements (HIPAA, GDPR, PCI-DSS) must be architected into the system from day one, not added as documentation after the fact.
content.decision5.desc: Non-functional requirements (performance, scalability, availability) are often vague or missing. Without clear NFRs, you can't make informed architecture decisions.
content.decision6.desc: Target state is a milestone, not a final destination. Architecture should evolve. Treating it as a one-time destination leads to rigid, hard-to-maintain systems.
content.decision7: Big bang migrations instead of sequencing for value
content.decision7.desc: Attempting to migrate everything at once is high-risk. Sequencing migrations by business value and technical dependencies reduces risk and delivers value incrementally.
content.decision8: Underestimating data migration and data ownership
content.decision8.desc: Data migration is often the most complex and risky part of modernization. Data quality, ownership, and governance must be addressed early.
content.decision9: Operating model not aligned with architecture
content.decision9.desc: A microservices architecture requires different operating models than monoliths. Team structure, deployment processes, and monitoring must align with the architecture.
content.decision10: Not creating a decision package (blueprint + risk register + roadmap)
content.decision10.desc: Architecture decisions need documentation: a blueprint showing current and target state, a risk register with mitigation strategies, and a roadmap for execution.
content.ctaText: Want to discuss these decisions in the context of your architecture?

footerBanner.text: Not ready to book a call? Get the free guide →

seo.title: Privacy Policy | Prasad Tilloo
seo.description: Privacy policy for Prasad Tilloo's portfolio website and lead magnet services.

dataCollection.title: Data Collection
dataCollection.description: We collect minimal data necessary to provide our services:
items: Email address (when you request the free guide)
Language preference (to send content in your preferred language)

dataUse.title: How We Use Your Data
dataUse.description: Your email address is used solely to send you the requested guide. We do not use your data for marketing purposes, and we do not share your data with third parties.

dataStorage.title: Data Storage
dataStorage.description: Your data is stored securely on our servers. We retain your email address only as long as necessary to fulfill your request. You can request deletion of your data at any time by contacting us.

yourRights.title: Your Rights (GDPR)
yourRights.description: Under GDPR, you have the following rights:
items: Right to access your personal data
Right to rectification of inaccurate data
Right to erasure ('right to be forgotten')

contact.title: Contact
contact.description: If you have questions about this privacy policy or wish to exercise your rights, please contact us:

unavailable.title: Feature Temporarily Unavailable
unavailable.message: This feature is currently disabled. Please contact support if you need access.

whatIs.title: What This Site Is
whatIs.description: An independent architecture consultant portfolio built with React + TypeScript, featuring experience-driven tools (Gemini 3 Pro), feature flags for phased rollout, GDPR-safe analytics, and production deployment on Google Cloud Run. The site demonstrates real-world enterprise architecture expertise through detailed case studies based on real delivery.

aiFeatures.title: AI Features
aiFeatures.description: This portfolio integrates Google Gemini 3 Pro for:

evidence.title: Evidence System
evidence.item1: Trust Layer: My role, scope owned, team collaboration, NDA disclaimers
evidence.item2: Artifact Previews: 6+ artifacts per case study (ADRs, diagrams, roadmaps)
evidence.item3: Credibility Signals: Duration, team size, region, engagement type

metrics.title: Metrics Dashboard
metrics.description: Impact metrics displayed on homepage: cost saved, projects delivered, compliance rate, data breaches prevented.

leadCapture.description: GDPR-safe lead capture with email delivery and Google Sheets storage. Includes attribution tracking (UTM params, referrer, landing path) without PII in analytics.
